data.title: All Bedfordshire primary schools Ofsted rated as 'requires improvement' or 'inadequate'
data.meta_description: A total of 18 primary schools in Bedfordshire were rated by Ofsted as needing to improve or inadequate
data.text:
Most educational institutions are rated by the watchdog Ofsted - including primary schools.

The regulatory body rates schools on targets such as effectiveness of management, quality of teaching, and pupil outcomes.

On each of these measures they are rated as either inadequate, requires improvement, good or outstanding.

Read more: All the Beds schools rated as 'requires improvement' or 'inadequate'

It can be concerning for parents if a school is rated as inadequate or requires improvement.

We have listed below every primary school in Bedfordshire which has been given one of these two ratings by Ofsted.

A total of 18 schools have received one of these ratings in Bedfordshire.

Luton primary school ratings

In Luton, Bedfordshire, 11 schools with primary teaching have been rated as requires improvement and one has been rated inadequate.

Beech Hill Community Primary School - requires improvement

Beech Hill Primary in Dunstable Road in Luton was rated as requiring improvement for its effectiveness of leadership, quality of teaching, pupil outcomes and early years provision. It was rated good for personal development.

Foxdell Junior School - requires improvement

This junior school on Dallow Road was rated requires improvement in 2019.

It was rated as requires improvement for quality of education. However it was good for behaviour and attitudes, personal development and leadership and management.

Maidenhall Primary School - requires improvement

Maidenhall Primary was last inspected in 2018 where it received a rating of requires improvement, down from a good rating in 2015.

Effectiveness of leadership, teaching quality, pupil outcomes and early years provision all needed improving. However personal development and behaviour were good.

Mehria Primary School - requires improvement

Mehria Primary is an independent school on Westbourne Road. It was rated as requires improvement in 2020.

The quality of education and leadership and management were rated as requires improvement.

Behaviour and attitudes and personal development were rated good.

Oakwood Primary School - requires improvement

Independent primary school Oakwood was rated requires improvement in March 2019.

Leadership effectiveness, teaching quality, pupil outcomes and early years provisions were rated requires improvement.

Personal development, behaviour and welfare were rated good.

Olive Tree Primary School - requires improvement

This independent school in Bury Park Road was last inspected in early 2019.

It was rated requires improvement in all sub categories.

Pirton Hill Primary School - requires improvement

Pirton Hill Primary had its last full inspection in 2018 and received a rating of requires improvement, a downgrade from 2015 when it received a good rating.

All categories were rated as requiring improvement.

Rabia Girls' and Boys' School - inadequate

This independent Islamic school received a rating of inadequate in 2018 - the latest standard inspection. It has students from ages five to 16.

Effectiveness of leadership, quality of teaching and personal development were all rated inadequate. Pupil outcomes required improvement.

St Margaret of Scotland Catholic Primary School - requires improvement

This academy school was rated as requires improvement in May 2018.

Quality of teaching and pupil outcomes were rated as requiring improvement.

Leadership effectiveness, personal development and early years provision were rated as good.

St Matthew's Primary School - requires improvement

This school on Wenlock Street was rated as requires improvement in 2019.

Teaching quality and pupil outcomes needed to be improved, but leadership effectiveness and personal development were good - and early years provision was outstanding.

The Linden Academy - requires improvement

The latest inspection for this school in 2018 said that all areas of inspection needed to be improved.

Wenlock CofE Junior School - requires improvement

This Church of England school in Beaconsfield Road needed to improve in all areas, except personal development where it was rated good.

Bedford primary school ratings

In Bedford Borough 13 primary schools have been rated as requiring improvement by Ofsted.

Bedford Road Primary School - requires improvement

The most recent full inspection in 2018 gave the school in Kempston requires improvement for all subcategories except personal development which was rated good.

Broadmead Lower School - requires improvement

Broadmead Lower in Park Crescent in Stewartby needed to improve effectiveness of leadership, teaching quality, and outcomes for pupils.

Personal development and early years provision were good.

Great Barford Church of England Primary Academy - requires improvement

This CofE primary in Silver Street, Bedford, required improvement as of its latest full report in 2019.

It needed improvement in every category except early years provision

Greys Education Centre - requires improvement

In 2020 the Ofsted report for Greys Education Centre Pupil Referral Unit in Kempston says it needed to improve its quality of education, personal development and leadership. Behaviour and attitudes was rated good.

Harrold Primary Academy - requires improvement

This primary school in Harrold needed to improve education quality and early years provision as of its 2019 report.

Behaviour, personal development and leadership were rated good.

King's Oak Primary School - requires improvement

King's Oak Primary on Oak Road in Bedford was rated requires improvement for all factors except early years provision - which was rated good - in its latest full report in 2018.

Queen's Park Academy - requires improvement

The latest full inspection of Queen's Park Academy in 2019 showed that every area except personal development required improvement.

Sheerhatch Primary School - requires improvement

The latest inspection in 2018 showed that Sheerhatch in Cople needed to improve leadership, teaching quality, and pupil outcomes.

St John Rigby Catholic Primary School - requires improvement

This Roman Catholic school in Polhill Avenue in Bedford needed to improve education quality, leadership and early years provosion.

Personal development and behaviour was rated good.

St Joseph's and St Gregory's Catholic Primary School - requires improvement

The latest inspection of this Roman Catholic school in 2019 said that education quality, behaviour and leadership needed improvement.

Early years and personal development were rated good by Ofsted.

St Lawrence Church of England Primary School - requires improvement

This CofE primary school in Wymington needed to improve in every area except personal development.

Westfield Primary School - requires improvement

Westfield Primary on Chester Road, Bedford, needed to improve in every area as of its latest inspection in 2018.

Wilden CofE VA Primary School - requires improvement

As of the latest inspection in 2018, this CofE primary needed to improve in every area except for personal development which was rated good.

Enter your postcode for the latest news in your area

Central Bedfordshire primary school ratings

Just three primary schools in central Beds have been rated as requiring improvement, none are inadequate.

Ardley Hill Academy - requires improvement

This school in Dunstable needed to improve its leadership and pupil outcomes as of its latest full inspection in 2018.

The quality of teaching, personal development and early years were rated good.

Ashton St Peter's VA C of E School - requires improvement

This CofE primary in Dunstable was rated as needing to improve all areas of inspection except personal development (rated good) as of its 2018 inspection.

Leedon Lower School - requires improvement

The latest report in 2019 showed this school in Leighton Buzzard needed to improve its effectiveness of leadership, quality of teaching, and pupil outcomes.

Personal development and early years provision were rated good.
